noun.description: A platform or compartment housed in a shaft for raising and lowering people or things to different floors or levels.
examples: in the elevator she pressed the button for the lobby

noun.description: A machine consisting of an endless belt with scoops attached, used typically for raising grain to be stored in an upper story.
A hinged flap on the horizontal stabilizer of an aircraft, typically one of a pair, used to control the motion of the aircraft about its lateral axis.
A muscle whose contraction raises a part of the body.
A shoe with a raised insole designed to make the wearer appear taller.

origin: Mid 17th century (denoting a muscle): modern Latin, from Latin elevare raise; in later use directly from elevate.
